titlestmt.titleproper: United States National Student Association Records, 1947-1965
titlestmt.subtitle: Finding Aid
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Jenna Novotny.

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded in NoteTab Pro. Encoded by Jeanne Lowrey. 2013-11-13

did.head: Collection Overview
did.unittitle: United States National Student Association Records

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The National Student Association was founded in 1947 as a confederation of student governments across the nation, united for the purpose of improving education. It advocated federal aid for education, student publications without censorship and it took a stand against discrimination. Smith College students began affiliation with the organization the year it was created. In 1978 it merged with the National Student Lobby, forming the United States Student Association.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents of the Collection
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of correspondence, conference publications, press releases, newspaper clippings, and photographs.

accessrestrict.p: The records are open for research according to the regulations of the Smith College Archives except where noted in the finding aid.

userestrict.p: Single photocopies may be made for research purposes. Permission to publish material from the documents must be requested from the Smith College Archives. Smith College owns copyright to any published material relating to college events and activities. Provenance and copyright ownership of other materials is unknown and researchers are responsible for determining any question of copyright.

prefercite.p: Please use the following format when citing materials from this collection:
United States National Student Association, Box #, Smith College Archives.

acqinfo.p: The records of the National Student Association were donated over a period of time to the Smith College Archives from a variety of sources.
